summary: This document is an internal email forwarding a news article from New York Magazine's Intelligencer titled 'Fraud and Blackmail: Jeffrey Epstein's Finances'. The email asks whether the office is investigating Epstein for fraud-related offenses, indicating internal consideration of expanding the investigation beyond sex trafficking to include financial crimes.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the forwarded news article and the email inquiry regarding potential fraud-related offenses.

events.title: Publication of Fraud and Blackmail Article
events.description: New York Magazine's Intelligencer publishes an article titled 'Fraud and Blackmail: Jeffrey Epstein's Finances'.

events.title: Internal Inquiry on Epstein Fraud Investigation
events.description: An internal email is sent asking if the office is looking at Jeffrey Epstein for fraud-related offenses, linking to the New York Magazine article.

keyFacts: An internal email dated July 31, 2019, questions whether the office is investigating Jeffrey Epstein for fraud-related offenses.
The email forwards a link to a New York Magazine Intelligencer article titled 'Fraud and Blackmail: Jeffrey Epstein's Finances'.
This indicates that, as of July 2019, authorities were considering or being asked to consider financial crimes as part of the Epstein investigation.
